node.title: A Melbourne supermarket racially profiled African customers for three years. Now it's apologising
node.alt: Image of sign on check out computer, with hand of sales assistance out of focus in front.
node.description: An IGA store in Melbourne apologises for displaying a sign encouraging staff to seek extra assistance when African people entered the store.
node.content:
["A supermarket\u00a0in Melbourne's outer west has apologised after encouraging\u00a0its staff to racially profile its customers and ask\u00a0for extra assistance\u00a0if\u00a0African people entered the store.", "For three years, the\u00a0IGA in Sunshine West\u00a0had a sign taped to\u00a0its\u00a0cash register that\u00a0stated:\u00a0\"If an African customer comes to the bottle shop presses [sic]\u00a0the button for assistant immediately!\"", "\"Minimum 2 staffs in front while we serve Africans,\" the sign\u00a0also read.", "The manager of the store, who did not want to share his name with the ABC, said he had\u00a0taken down the sign after it was shared widely on social media, and apologised\u00a0for offending the community.", "He said he wanted to put the sign up as a reminder to his staff that if a \"stranger or African\" comes\u00a0in, they should\u00a0press a\u00a0button to alert other staff members.", "\"We [can] get somebody to stand next to them just for safety reasons,\" he said, adding the alert button was not only used for African customers, but also when the store was busy.", "An apology note\u00a0was written on Monday afternoon and placed on a bench near the cash register.\u00a0", "", "
Staff wrote this apology note after an image of the sign was circulated online.(ABC News: Dana Morse)
", "\"We would like to apologies [sic] to anyone that got offended by the note we had \u2026 it was not our intention to offend,\" the note said.", "The manager said\u00a0the store had\u00a0received several complaints from customers about the sign, which was why he decided to put up a\u00a0new sign apologising to Sunshine's African-Australian community.", "\"We don't really mean for this, we apologise for what we've done. I'm sorry it will never happen again like that,\" he said.", "\"I've done the wrong thing for the public, we should not do like this.\"", "The manager said\u00a0he should have told his staff to press the button if a group of strangers entered his store,\u00a0rather than singling out African customers.", "\"It is my mistake. Big mistake,\" he said.", "
Supermarket implements mandatory training
", "", "
Metcash, the operators of the Sunshine West IGA, say mandatory training will be put in place for all store staff after the incident.(ABC News: Dana Morse)
", "The manager of the store said\u00a0he had\u00a0not been visited by IGA's head office about the matter, and that he had not received\u00a0racial-sensitivity training in his role.", "\"They say if something like this [happens] next time, just\u00a0better train\u00a0the staff if they really need help to press the button, and don't [be] racist [to]\u00a0anyone,\" the IGA store manager said.", "But\u00a0a spokesperson for wholesaler\u00a0Metcash, which operates the\u00a0chain of IGA supermarkets, said once\u00a0the sign was brought to their attention, the company\u00a0took action to remove it\u00a0and implement mandatory training for all staff.", "\"This type of behaviour is unacceptable and will not be tolerated in any IGA store across the country,\" a spokesperson told the ABC in a statement.", "\"As part of our ongoing commitment to supporting local communities across Australia, we will ensure ALL IGA employees continue to create a shopping environment where all are welcome and equal.\"", "", "
The manager of the IGA store says it was not his intention to offend anyone with his store's policies.(ABC News: Dana Morse)
", "The IGA manager said he treated\u00a0all his customers in the\u00a0Sunshine West store like a friend.", "\"We never have these kind of issues,\" he said.", "\"Customers are like a god for us. We treat them like friends.\""]
